greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of numbers k with 0 <= k < n such that 2^k + 1 is multiple of n.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: nn = 100; pwrs = 2^Range[0, nn] + 1; Table[cnt = 0; Do[If[Mod[pwrs[[i]], n] == 0, cnt++], {i, n}]; cnt, {n, nn}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Sep 30 2011 *)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 21 2011
